ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Heritrix pauses at seemingly random intervals
ygData.msgSnippet: Ah, well, the fact that your try/catch(Exception) doesn t catch it, that ToeThread.seriousError() ends up being called, and also the name of the class, all

--047d7b33d2fce31a5804e3761294
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Ah, well, the fact that your try/catch(Exception) doesn't catch it, that
ToeThread.seriousError() ends up being called, and also the name of the
class, all suggest that com.phloc.css.parser.TokenMgrError is a
java.lang.Error.

"An Error is a subclass of Throwable that indicates serious problems that a
reasonable application should not try to catch."

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/lang/Error.html

That library really should not be throwing Error in this case. I don't see
the class here, so maybe they realized that and changed it, and maybe a
newer version of the library wouldn't have the problem.
https://code.google.com/p/phloc-css/source/browse/#svn%2Ftrunk%2Fphloc-css%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2Fjava%2Fcom%2Fphloc%2Fcss%2Fparser

In the mean time you could add a catch(TokenMgrError) clause to your try
block. (You could also catch(Throwable) but that could cause problems
because you want to let real errors like OutOfMemoryError through).

Noah

> All the css errors are like this one. I have a try/catch(Exception) around
> the part that uses phloc, so any and all errors should be caught, but
> Heritrix seems to be pausing because of some reason somehow unrelated to
> exception handling.
> Niels
>
>
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:

> > It doesn't pause automatically pauses on any "severe error", only on a
> > "serious error" (like OOME). What exactly are these css errors?
> >

> pauses?
